title: (x) Font ID Please // Dot Typography for Pfizer kit - custom, various alternatives {gang}
content:
Hi everyone!

I was hoping someone out there may be able to identify this typeface.

It was used in a concept kit by Siegel+Gale for Pfizer.

Here is a link to the article from which the crop originates incase that helps.

[http://www.underconsideration.com/brandnew/archives/pfizer\_moves\_pforwar...](http://web.archive.org/web/20150328193300/http:/www.underconsideration.com/brandnew/archives/pfizer_moves_pforward.php "http://www.underconsideration.com/brandnew/archives/pfizer\_moves\_pforward.php")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150328193300im_/http:/typophile.com/files/pfizer_dot_type_crop_3525.jpg)

Thanks for the help. Appreciate it.
author: Pixels

comments.content: Sorry, but I don't think that's a typeface. I think that is hanmade.
I agree. You might like [Stag Dot](http://web.archive.org/web/20150328193300/http:/www.vllg.com/Schwartzco/Stag_Dot#panel=poster-mudtyper) as a substitute.
See also this blog post on Aegir Hallmundur’s Ministry of Type: [Dot, Dot, Dot](http://web.archive.org/web/20150328193300/http:/ministryoftype.co.uk/words/article/dot_dot_dot/)

Hmm, I had thought that might be the case but was hoping maybe it wasn't =P

Thank you all for the feedback and suggestions!
